
## Python Common String Methods and Built-in Functions

### Must-Know String Methods

| Function | Description |
|---|---|
| `.upper()` | Converts a string to uppercase. |
| `.lower()` | Converts a string to lowercase. |
| `.find()` | Finds the index of a substring within a string. |
| `.replace()` | Replaces occurrences of a substring within a string. |
| `.split()` | Splits a string into a list of substrings based on a delimiter. |
| `.join()` | Joins elements of an iterable into a string using a separator. |
| `.strip()` | Removes leading and trailing whitespace from a string. |
| `.startswith()` | Checks if a string starts with a specified prefix. |
| `.endswith()` | Checks if a string ends with a specified suffix. |
| `.count()` | Counts the number of occurrences of a substring within a string. |


### Good-to-Know String Methods

| Function | Description |
|---|---|
| `.encode()` | Encodes a string using a specified encoding. |
| `.translate()` | Replaces characters in a string using a translation table. |
| `.capitalize()` | Capitalizes the first character of a string. |
| `.center()` | Centers a string within a specified field width. |
| `.casefold()` | Converts a string to a casefolded version for case-insensitive comparisons. |
| `.expandtabs()` | Expands tab characters in a string. |
| `.index()` | Finds the index of a substring within a string, raising an exception if not found. |
| `.format()` | Creates a formatted string using placeholders. |
| `.format_map()` | Formats a string using substitutions from a mapping. |
| `.__contains__()` | Checks if a substring is contained within a string (using the `in` operator). |

### Miscellaneous String Methods

| Function | Description |
|---|---|
| `.isalnum()` | Checks if a string consists only of alphanumeric characters. |
| `.isalpha()` | Checks if a string consists only of alphabetic characters. |
| `.isdecimal()` | Checks if a string consists only of decimal characters. |
| `.isdigit()` | Checks if a string consists only of digit characters. |
| `.isidentifier()` | Checks if a string is a valid Python identifier. |
| `.islower()` | Checks if all cased characters in a string are lowercase. |
| `.isnumeric()` | Checks if a string consists only of numeric characters. |
| `.isprintable()` | Checks if a string consists only of printable characters. |
| `.isspace()` | Checks if a string consists only of whitespace characters. |
| `.istitle()` | Checks if a string is in title case. |
| `.isupper()` | Checks if all cased characters in a string are uppercase. |
| `.rjust()` | Right-justifies a string within a specified field width. |
| `.ljust()` | Left-justifies a string within a specified field width. |
| `.swapcase()` | Swaps the case of characters in a string. |
| `.partition()` | Splits a string into three parts based on a separator. |
| `.splitlines()` | Splits a string into a list of lines. |
| `.title()` | Converts a string to title case. |
| `.zfill()` | Fills a string with zeros on the left to a specified width. |

### Built-in Functions Working with Strings

| Function | Description |
|---|---|
| `len()` | Returns the length of a string. |
| `ascii()` | Returns a string representation of an object, escaping non-ASCII characters. |
| `bool()` | Converts an object to a Boolean value. |
| `bytearray()` | Creates a bytearray object from a string. |
| `bytes()` | Creates a bytes object from a string. |
| `ord()` | Returns the Unicode code point of a character. |
| `enumerate()` | Creates an iterator that produces tuples of indices and values from a sequence. |
| `float()` | Converts a string to a floating-point number. |
| `hash()` | Returns the hash value of a string. |
| `id()` | Returns the unique identifier of an object. |
| `int()` | Converts a string to an integer. |
| `map()` | Applies a function to each element of an iterable. |
| `print()` | Prints a value to the console. |
| `slice()` | Creates a slice object representing a range of indices. |
| `type()` | Returns the type of an object. |
